content.description: Sit start low on sidepull. Climb face using arete and dishes out left. Jugs on both sides of arete are off.
content.location: Next boulder to left of the Rail. On smooth arete.

content.description: Stand start in jugs. Move left to arete, squeeze behind tree, then up.
content.protection: Spotter(s) and pad. Careful of stump if at the grade
content.location: Front Area/Ten Pins

content.description: Sit start on low crimps and really bad feet. From crimps to jugs. From here shoot to  a jug in a break.
content.location: Ten Pins boulder. Next to Popeye.

content.description: Sit start on low pocket and sloper. Work through slopers then up face to finish on jugs.
content.location: Left of Picante, next to tree.

content.description: Stand start, climb the pockets to top.
content.location: Front Area/Ten Pins area

content.description: Committing v2.... start on jugs and go up a mix of slopers and jugs.
content.location: Left of Copa Cabana, you'll see 2 lowest jugs. Thats it. There are two ways to get down. Go to wear the two boulders are closest, and stem down, OR jump to the other boulder and climb down the v0.

content.description: Sit start same as Miriachi. Trend left across better holds. Top out in groove between aretes.
content.location: Starts at Mariachi and works left.

content.description: Start with left paw on good pocket and a sloper for your right paw. Moving up and left to sloper edges, then bump for your right. Finish on water grooves that tend to split jug.
content.location: Left of Flexing Flake, far left end of boulder.

content.description: Climb sloping breaks up bulbous face.
content.location: Front Area

content.description:
For many, this is as hard as V2 gets. It's all in the topout on this oft-tried problem. It seems that everyone has their own trick beta, which invariably doesn't work. I saw a guy send Ghetto Superstar (V9), then walk over to the crowd around Sandbox, step in, and fail. Repeatedly. You must know how to mantle to be successful. 

  Start standing with a right hand in a nice sidepull pocket and left on a decent crimp. Reach way up and left for a juggy pocket, then up right for another pocket. From here, rock the topout using whatever foolish beta you've been able to contrive. Try again. 

  Note: The protective outer sandstone layer has worn off the front of the problem, leaving an exposed area of what is essentially compacted sand. This sand flakes off in copious quantities (hence the name) when climbers try desperately to push themselves onto the boulder's top. This means that over the years, footholds have been created and subsequently disappeared. The problem is constantly changing, which is part of what makes it so classic.
content.location: In the 'Ten Pin' area. Locate the small, beautifully-colored boulder in the middle of the area. Downclimb the back, if you manage to make it up at all.

content.description: Low start with sketchy feet. Start on flake, then shoot for the obvious jug in break. Make a long move to sloper with yer right paw, then finish on slopers and better feet.
content.location: About 5 ft. left of Louis Groove.

content.description: Climb rail to top.  Most people use this problem as the decent after climbing the others on the boulder.
content.protection: Pad .... but train harder if you actually need it.
content.location: Front Area/Ten Pins

content.description: Sit start same for Behind The Tree. Move up and traverse left to nice jugs then up for finish.
content.location: Starts with Behind The Tree

content.description: A short campus problem...
content.location: Ten Pins Boulders, in between "Thugs and Bitches" and "Hugs and Kisses"

content.description: Stand start, climb pockets.
content.location: Front Area

content.description: Sit start on pockets, then trend up to good holds on the arete. Stay on arete to finish.
content.location: Just left of The Drip.

content.description: Begin below the roof on a good jug then move up and left to a goof finger bucket over the lip.  Look for a sloping crimper on the face out right then make a few more tough moves to the top.  Stout at V4.
content.location: On the Ten Pins boulder, side facing away from the campsites.

content.description: Climb slightly bulging face to a angled crimp.  Step up and reach to great jug pocket.  Reach up to the slopey groove and press/mantle the top out staying in the groove.
content.location: Ten Pins Boulders.

content.description: Climbs a fun, featured face to the left of a pine tree (imagine that!) Start standing and follow jugs and good slopers with some reachy moves to a somewhat high topout. A fine warmup that is nonetheless a bit too easy to be memorable.
content.location: In the Ten Pin area, on the boulder immediately to the left of Sandbox. Locate an obvious line (actually between two pine trees) directly across from the Sandbox downclimb.

content.description: Arete. Crux just below the top out. Get your foot STUCK and top out this fun problem.
content.location: Far left of Spur of the Moment were the boulder ends. The arete formed is the problem. Go straight up the arete, traversing left or right to the loving jugs is not the problem.

content.description: "Sketchy." Stand start, climb face to point possible to enter groove, then to top.
content.location: Ten Pins Boulders

content.description: Sit start with left undercling and right low sidepull. Make big move to a high sloping break and match on that break, then finish on easier ground.
content.location: Next bigger boulder next to the dirt road.

content.description:
Sit-start, face climb, and transition into the crack climb in front of the thin pine tree. 

 Great crack climbing practice/introduction. The sit-start is a bit hard for beginners and can be started standing.
content.location: Right of Ketchup Left of Upward Gardening Behind the thin pine tree

content.description: Start left paw on sidepull under roof and right paw on the nice crimper on the on the prow. Nice long move with right paw to sweet crimper on arete and continue through slopers to jugs to  finish.
content.location: Around the corner from Baja next to tree.

content.description: Climb the honeycomb face to a slopey top out.
content.location: Ten Pins Boulders

content.description: Start with underclings. get feet on, shoot for jug and mantle out.
content.location: Left of Honey 2 on smaller boulder next to this boulder.

content.description: Start on good pocket, and simply mantel to finish.
content.location: Just left of Honey 1

content.description: Start with left paw on sidepull and right on sloper at bottom of runnel. Get feet high and mantle out to finish.
content.location: Left of Fat Woman/Ten Pins boulders

content.description: Stand start left facing pinch. Climb pockets to finish with mantle
content.location: Ten Pens area. Just right of the tree that touches boulder.

content.description: Start on the sandy sloper in the break. Campus to right facing jug. Finish to the slopey top.
content.location: Left of JJ

content.description: Stand Start. Begin with underclings, then climb through flake, then through jugs to a famous HP40 sloper top out.
content.location: Just left of Reprise

content.description: Start with left paw in groove and right paw on sloper at the bottom of the obvious rail. Launch right into groove and squeeze to finish.
content.location: Ten Pins boulder with low rail.

content.description: Stand start, then simply climb the white face.
content.location: Left of Left of Pine

content.description: Starts just left of Flexing Flake on pinch left paw and right on sloper, make your next move to the sloper on Flexing Flake and traverse right to finish on JJ
content.location: Starts just left of Flexing Flake and ends on JJ

content.description:
Sit start and climb up the arete using holds on both sides and the the occasional heel hook.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hZTdX_KFxhU&t=16s
content.location: Ten Pins Boulders.

content.description: Stand start in left facing jug. Easy finish.
content.location: left of Cheese.

content.description: Stand start, pull on small crimpers at around 5 ft., then bump to better holds. Mantle out on knob for the finish.
content.location: Left around the corner from Honey 3.

content.description: Sit start, climb jugs up arete.
content.location: Front Area

content.description: Sit start on crimps (left of thugs and Bitches), then up to jugs. From here traverse seam and top out on Hugs and Kisses.
content.location: Just Left of Thugs and Bitches.

content.description: Sit start on low pocket for yer right paw, and climb arete to top.
content.location: Left of Las Americas, across gap between boulders on arete.

content.description: Sit start. Climb blunt arete. Heel hookin may help.
content.location: Behind the store in the Ten Pins area.

content.description: Low start on edge for yer right paw, and an exciting pinch for yer left paw. A couple of nice moves gets you to good ground for the finish.
content.location: Left of Breaktime, just left past the obvious water groove.

content.description: First Area directly behind the camp store. This is usually the area that most folks start with. Rock quality is slopey
